snippet: In recognition of Fair Trade Month in October, Green Mountain Coffee is seeking to educate its customers about fair-trade certification.
abstract: Andrew Adam Newman Advertising column notes Green Mountain Coffee will introduce an advertising campaign aimed at educating consumers about fair-trade certification, which the brand receives from nonprofit group Fair Trade USA.

headline.main: This Wake-Up Cup Is Fair-Trade Certified
headline.print_headline: This Wake-Up Cup Is Fair-Trade Certified

snippet: Pete Wells was there as a top Chicago restaurant brought its menu and staff to Eleven Madison Park on Wednesday night.
abstract: Pete Wells was there as a top Chicago restaurant brought its menu and staff to Eleven Madison Park on Wednesday night.

headline.main: Slight Rebellion Off Madison: Alinea Drops In

snippet: Research in Motion said its net loss for the latest quarter was $235 million, a comedown from a year ago but an improvement on the previous quarter. Its shares surged after hours.
abstract: Research in Motion, troubled manufacturer of the BlackBerry smartphone, reports a second-quarter net loss of $235 million, smaller than the first-quarter loss of $518 million, but down sharply from a $329 million profit in the year-ago quarter; company continues to face a difficult future as it struggles to get a new model out the door.

headline.main: BlackBerry Maker Posts a Narrower Loss, and Stock Jumps in After-Hours Trading
headline.print_headline: BlackBerry Maker Posts a Narrower Loss, and Stock Jumps in After-Hours Trading

snippet: Nobody ever raved about Google’s mapping app for phones until they saw how hard it was for Apple to come up with a rival.
abstract: Nobody ever raved about Google’s mapping app for phones until they saw how hard it was for Apple to come up with a rival.

headline.main: What Makes Google's Maps So Good

snippet: The core features of Camera+, a popular iPhone app that expanded to the iPad on Thursday, are its editing suite and integration of Apple’s iCloud storage service.
abstract: The core features of Camera+, a popular iPhone app that expanded to the iPad on Thursday, are its editing suite and integration of Apple’s iCloud storage service.

headline.main: Camera+, a Top-Selling iPhone App, Expands to iPad

snippet: Also, David Pogue gets lost as he test drives the new Apple maps for the iPhone 5, and J.K. Rowling's novel for adults is reviewed by Michiko Kakutani.
abstract: Also, David Pogue gets lost as he test drives the new Apple maps for the iPhone 5, and J.K. Rowling's novel for adults is reviewed by Michiko Kakutani.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: N.F.L. Quickly Reverses on Referees, and Satire Gone Wild

snippet: Think your Web mail service might be down? Here's how to check on it.
abstract: Think your Web mail service might be down? Here's how to check on it.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Checking the Mail Service

snippet: The departure of James Gooch, who became RadioShack’s chief executive in May 2011, follows an unexpected $21 million loss in the electronics retailer’s latest quarter.
abstract: RadioShack says its chief executive James F Gooch is stepping down immediately under agreement with company's board, in the latest turmoil at the struggling electronics retailer.

snippet: Apple has replaced Google’s maps with its own, built from scratch, but in the new app entire locations have been mislabeled or erased. We try to track down the problems.
abstract: David Pogue State of the Art column on Apple's replacement of Google’s maps with its own, inferior mapping system, built from scratch; notes in new iPhone app entire locations have been mislabeled or erased; contends making the app reliable and complete will take a very long time.

headline.main: A Map App, as Sleek as iPhone 5, Is Often Off
headline.print_headline: A Map App, As Sleek As iPhone 5, Is Often Off
